definition: vicious circle
to hate/to loathe/ashamed/to fear/to slander
evil/fierce/vicious/ugly/coarse/to harm
see 惡心|恶心[e3 xin1]
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]
to follow/to adhere to/to abide by
ring/hoop/loop/(chain) link/classifier for scores in archery etc/to surround/to encircle/to hem in
surname Huan

sentences.english: Are policy makers ready to do what it takes to break this vicious circle?
sentences.chinese: 决策者们准备采取措施打破这种恶性循环码？

sentences.english: The process becomes a self-reinforcing feedback loop.
sentences.chinese: 这个过程将成为自我强化的恶性循环。

sentences.english: To break this vicious circle, it is essential to promote development in drug-growing regions.
sentences.chinese: 为了打破这种恶性循环，必须促进毒品种植区的发展。

sentences.english: Yet how could the habsburgs escape from this vicious circle ?
sentences.chinese: 那么，哈布斯堡如何才能逃脱这种恶性循环呢？

sentences.english: The result is a feedback loop that accelerates local warming.
sentences.chinese: 其结果是一个恶性循环，加速局地的暖化。

sentences.english: A circle, in other words, is not necessarily a vicious circle.
sentences.chinese: 循环并不一定是恶性循环。

sentences.english: That could drop local governments into a vicious circle of cash strains.
sentences.chinese: 这可能会让地方政府陷入资金紧张的恶性循环。

sentences.english: This vicious circle must be broken somehow,” Urani explained.
sentences.chinese: 无论如何必须打破这一恶性循环。

sentences.english: And so the vicious cycle begins.
sentences.chinese: 就这样，恶性循环又开始了。

sentences.english: This can be a dangerous cycle.
sentences.chinese: 这有可能成为一个恶性循环。

sentences.english: So the bad circulation still goes around, one more round, betting once more.
sentences.chinese: 于是恶性循环，再来一轮，再赌一把。

definition: virtuous cycle (i.e. positive feedback loop)
vicious circle/(abnormal) phenomenon
over time/as time passes/in the fullness of time
(psychology) learned helplessness
pinyin: xi2 de2 xing4 wu2 zhu4 gan3

definition: to fall deeper and deeper (in debt, in love etc)
to lead to/to create/to cause/to bring about
to intensify/to sharpen/to accelerate/to aggravate/to exacerbate/to embitter
evil consequence/retribution (in Buddhism)
mutually related karma (idiom); fates are intertwined/interdependent
to sink into/to get caught up in/to land in (a predicament)
to unbalance/an imbalance
anxious/worried/apprehensive
to produce the opposite of the desired result
lit. to smash a cracked pot (idiom); crazy despair in the face of a blemish, defect, error or setback
lose-lose (situation)/(of the two sides involved) to both be disadvantaged
inferiority complex
